questions.question_text: The company's new policy requires all employees to submit their expense reports _____ the end of each month.
questions.explanation: The sentence requires employees to submit their expense reports by a specific point in time, which is indicated by the phrase 'the end of each month'. The correct answer is 'by' because it indicates the point in time when the action of submitting expense reports needs to be completed.

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy has been successfully implemented _____ the company's sales figures have increased significantly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'since' because the sentence describes a condition that began before another action started. The phrase 'the company's sales figures have increased significantly' indicates the result of implementing the new marketing strategy, which happened after the strategy was put in place.

questions.question_category: 填入考點（tense / pos / syntax / vocab 擇一）
questions.question_text: The company's new policy requires all employees to _____ a minimum of 20 hours of training every year.
questions.explanation: The question tests the candidate's understanding of the present simple passive voice. The correct answer is 'receive' because it matches the context and the requirement of a minimum of 20 hours of training every year.

questions.question_text: The new employee handbook is available on our __________ website, where you can access relevant information and policies.
questions.explanation: The blank should be filled with the word "internal" because it refers to a website that is only accessible to employees, making it a internal resource. This option is correct as it is related to the concept of an employee handbook being available on a company's internal website.

questions.question_text: By the time you _____ your doctor, you will have had all the necessary tests.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'have seen' because the passage describes a future action that has not yet occurred, so the perfect tense is used to describe an action in the past.

questions.question_text: The company has been considering the acquisition of a rival firm since __________ it was established.
questions.explanation: 本題要求填寫一個since引導的子句，選項A「when」正好fit在語境中，因為it was established指的是公司的創立時間，而since it was established表示自從這個時候起，因此should be filled with when。

questions.question_text: The company will ______ a comprehensive marketing strategy to increase brand awareness, starting from next quarter.
questions.explanation: 這題考察的是將來perfect continuous tense的使用，選項 D 中的 "implement" 是正確答案，因為句子表明公司即將開始實施一個全面的市場策略，而不是已經或曾經實施過。

questions.question_text: The company has been working on a new project __________ the past six months.
questions.explanation: 該句子使用了 since  subordinating conjunction，表示從某個時間點開始到現在的時間段。選項 B 是正確答案，因為它們表達了與since  相似的意思。

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy has resulted in a significant increase in sales, and we expect this trend to _____ by the end of the year.
questions.explanation: 本題目考查完成式（Continuous Future）對於將來的描述。選項 B «maintain»正確，因為我們預期這個趨勢直到年底都維持不變。

questions.question_text: The company's policy is to ______ all new employees with a comprehensive training program within the first six months.
By the end of this year, our company is expected to _____ a 10% increase in sales.
questions.explanation: 這題考慮的是將來完成式的使用，表示預計在今年底公司的銷售額會增加10%，因此選項 B "have made" 是正確的選項。

questions.question_category: 填入考點(tense / pos / syntax / vocab)
questions.question_text: The company has been implementing a new policy _____ all employees are encouraged to share their innovative ideas.
questions.explanation: 本題目考察時態的使用，選項 C 'from now on' 表示從某個時間點開始，因此與空格的語意相關，即公司自某個時間點開始鼓勵員工分享創新想法。

questions.question_text: The new employee handbook includes information on company policies and procedures that all staff members must _____.
questions.explanation: 本題目考察了主詞與不定詞的關係。句子中需要填入一個表示必須遵守或遵循的不定詞，選項 A『adhere to』是正確答案，因為 it is the most common and natural way to express this idea in English。

questions.question_text: The new employee orientation program has been streamlined to reduce the time it takes for new hires to become _____ familiar with our company’s policies.
questions.explanation: 這個句子使用一般将来时，指出新的員工訓練計畫將會讓新聘用人員更快速地 Familiar with our company’s policies。選項 D 是正確的，因為 it takes for new hires to become fully familiar with our company’s policies 的表達方式需要使用完全 familiar。

questions.question_text: The new office building will be equipped with state-of-the-art _______ to enhance the productivity of employees.
questions.explanation: 句子中需要填入一個名詞短語，該短語是指公司所需設備的描述。選項 A 是正確答案，因為它使用了正确的语法结构和词汇，符合題目要求。

questions.question_text: The company will be celebrating its 10th anniversary next year, having ___________ in the market for five years already.
questions.explanation: 這個題目考查完成式的使用。在這裡，「having done business」表示從五年前開始在市場上經營了五年，而不是「do business」，所以選項 C 是正確答案。

questions.question_text: The new patient scheduling system has been implemented _____ all clinics within the past year.
questions.explanation: 本題目考查了present perfect tense的使用情況，句子中描述的是一種過去完成的動作，即某件事情在某個特定的點之前已經完成。因此選項C 'by the time'正確，因為它指出了該系統在所有診所內於前年實施。

questions.question_text: The new software has been designed to improve the efficiency of the manufacturing process, which will enable us to _____ our products faster.
questions.explanation: This question tests the candidate's understanding of the future perfect continuous tense. The sentence describes an action that will be completed at a point in the future, so the correct answer is 'manufacture', which indicates the completion of producing products.

questions.question_text: The company’s new policy emphasizes the importance of ________ all customer feedback to improve product development.
questions.explanation: 這是一個syntax題目，考察主詞和不定詞的關係。在本句中， customer feedback 是一個不定詞，需要被表達為一個祈使句，thus the correct answer is to address。

questions.question_text: The company's new policy states that all employees are entitled to _____ a minimum of 20 days' paid vacation each year.
questions.explanation: 本題目考察的是一般過去時的使用，句子中的動詞「entitled」表示公司對員工的規定，而不是描述某個特定的事件，因此應選擇一般過去時的to receive。

questions.question_text: By the time we launch our new product, we will have _____ testing and refining its features for three months.
questions.explanation: 這題考的是完式（Perfect tense）的使用，選項 B 中的 conducting 是描述一段時間內進行某個動作的習慣用法，符合情境所需。

questions.question_text: The company has been developing a new product line that will be launched _____ the next quarter.
questions.explanation: 句子中使用了time clause，需要在上文定義的時間點前進行某種行動，因此選項D after正確。

questions.question_text: The company has been considering the possibility of _____ its market share by expanding its e-commerce platform.
questions.explanation: 選項 D 'will have gained' 是正確答案，因為句子中的動詞 'considering' 表示一個將來的可能性，因此使用未來完成式 ('will have gained') 來表達這個可能性。

questions.question_text: The company has been looking forward to expanding its operations into new markets since it _____ the current financial crisis.
questions.explanation: 本題考查簡過去式（Simple Past）與現在完成式（Present Perfect）的對比。since it overcame the current financial crisis 表示自從克服金融危機以來，所以選項 C 是正確的。

questions.question_category: 填入考點（tense / pos / syntax / vocab）
questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy has resulted in a significant increase in sales, which is expected to _____ this quarter’s revenue.
questions.explanation: 本題考查句子的連貫性和詞義關係，選項 C 是正確的原因是因為此前提出了“significant increase in sales”，因此在此 quarter 的 revenue 也會增加，surpass 表示超過或超越，這個詞彙與上下文的連貫性高度相關。

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy has led to a significant increase in sales, which is expected to _____ our quarterly profits.
questions.explanation: 這題考查詞彙的義務，選項 A 的 boost 是正確答案，因為在句中表示新市場策略導致的銷售增加將帶來的財務收益增長。

questions.question_text: The new product development process has been streamlined _____ the team’s feedback since 2018.
questions.explanation: 本題目考察的是過去完成式（Past Perfect）與現在完了式（Present Perfect）的使用情況。在這個句子中，new product development process 有過去完成式的特點，因為它描述了一個在某個特定的時間點之前發生的事件（since 2018）。因此，正確的選項是 since。

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy was implemented _____ the company’s financial performance improved significantly.
questions.explanation: 這題考的是從句的時間關係，要求選擇與空格相符的時態。Here, the correct answer is 'since' because it indicates that the marketing strategy was implemented at a point in time when the company's financial performance improved significantly.

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy will be implemented_____ the end of this quarter.
questions.explanation: 這題考查的是语法结构，特指 conditional sentence 的 timing 子句。選項 A `until` 是正確答案，因為它描述了一个动作的时间点，即在本季度结束时。

questions.question_text: The company's employee handbook states that all new hires must attend a comprehensive training session within _____ of their start date.
questions.explanation: 此題考查填空句中的定語從句，考生需要選擇在句中所需的時間單位，從而形成正確的定語從句。

questions.question_text: New product development at XYZ Corporation often involves _____ the latest technological advancements.
questions.explanation: 這題考的是fill-in-the-blank的 Vocabulary 考試。選項 C "integrating" 是正確答案，因為 XYZ Corporation 的新產品開發可能涉及整合最新技術進步。

questions.question_text: The company's new product development team is responsible for _____ the innovative ideas submitted by employees.
questions.explanation: 本題目考查 syntax 的用法，選項 D«implementing»是正確的，因為在句子中，team 是負責將員工提交的創新想法付諸實踐（put into practice），故應使用 gerund  form «implementing».

questions.question_text: The doctor has been _ ___________ patients with chronic diseases since 2015.
questions.explanation: 這是一個表示「doctor 的行為」的情況，需要使用過去式（since 2015），因此選項 B 是正確的。

questions.question_text: The new building regulations require all electrical installations to be done in accordance with _____ standards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is internationally recognized, as it accurately reflects the sentence's meaning and follows the grammatical structure.

questions.question_text: The real estate agent suggested that we _____ the property before making an offer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'inspect' because it fits the context and grammar of the sentence. The sentence is asking for an action that should be taken before making an offer, and 'inspect' is a suitable verb in this context.

questions.question_text: The company's policy states that all expenses must be _____ by the end of the month.
questions.explanation: 本題目考察了句子的语法结构，要求使用正确的词汇填充空格，以表示句子的逻辑关系。选项 B 'logged' 是正确答案，因为它符合句子中的语境和逻辑关系。

questions.question_text: According to the company’s latest report, new employees are required to take an orientation course _____ they start working.
questions.explanation: This sentence uses the correct preposition 'prior to' to indicate the timing of the orientation course, emphasizing that it must be taken before starting work.

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy has resulted in a significant increase in sales, _____ we have been experiencing a decline in revenue.
questions.explanation: 這題考察了子句的連接，選項 C 的 although 是正確答案，因為 it indicates a contrast between the two clauses.

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy has improved our sales figures _____ the past six months.
questions.explanation: 此題考驗主句與副句的關係，選項 B 'since'正確，因為新 Marketing 策略始於過去六個月，而不是之前或之後。

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy was developed to _blank_ the growing demand for eco-friendly products.
questions.explanation: The sentence is talking about developing a marketing strategy to cope with the growing demand. The correct option is 'meet' because it implies taking action to match or equal the demand.

questions.question_text: Patients at the medical center are required to _____ their medication as directed.
questions.explanation: 此題考查語法的 infinitive phrase，患者需要「take」自己的藥物，如指示所示。

questions.question_text: The new employee was instructed to submit a weekly report to the manager _____ she started her job.
questions.explanation: The sentence uses the adverb 'since' to indicate the point of time when something started happening. This is an example of using the 'since' clause to connect a dependent clause to an independent clause.

questions.question_text: The company will provide all necessary equipment and software for the project, including _____ network infrastructure.
questions.explanation: The question tests the test-taker's ability to complete a sentence with a prepositional phrase. The correct answer is 'another' because it fits the syntax of the sentence, making sense in the context of providing equipment and software for the project.

questions.question_text: The new policy encourages employees to share their ideas and suggestions through a regular _______ of meetings.
questions.explanation: 本題目考試的語法是定冠詞（the） + 名詞複數（meetings），選項 D 的 regular meeting precisely matches the blank, which indicates a series of meetings.

questions.question_text: The company's marketing strategy was revised _____ the disappointing sales figures last quarter.
questions.explanation: 選項 B "as a result of" 是正確答案，因為句子表明公司對於前一季的不佳銷售數據進行了變革。其他選項都無法與句子的邏輯相符。

questions.question_text: The company has been expanding its global presence _____ it was founded five years ago.
questions.explanation: 選項 C 是正確的，因為句子中使用了since引言，表示從某個時間點開始，這個時間點是公司創立五年前。因此，選項 C 符合句子的語法邏輯。

questions.question_text: New product development is an ongoing process at TechCorp, as the company _____ to stay ahead of changing market trends.
questions.explanation: 此題考查 Syntax 的進度，選項 D 中的 will continue to 是正確答案，因為 New product development 是一個長期的過程，可以使用 ongoing process 表示，並且 will continue to 的用法是合適的。

questions.question_text: The company's policy states that all employees must _____ their annual reports by the end of March.
questions.explanation: 本題考查被動態句型，選項 A submit correct，因為 annual reports 是需要提交的文件。

questions.question_text: The new financial regulations will take effect _____ the company's quarterly earnings report is released.
questions.explanation: 此題考查將來時態的使用，選項 D 的「after that」正確，因為新金融規定會在公司的季度收益報告發布後生效。

questions.question_text: The company offers a comprehensive training program to all new employees, which includes _____ of their previous work experience.
questions.explanation: 本題目考查的是syntax，specifically the use of prepositions in this context。選項 D 'taking into account' best fits the blank as it indicates considering or taking into account something, which is the most logical and grammatically correct choice。

questions.question_text: The health insurance company requires patients to _____ their medical records before they can be released.
questions.explanation: 此題考察了句子中的「passive voice」和「causality」，患者需要將自己的醫療記錄提交，以便得以釋放。

questions.question_text: The company has been consistently expanding its market share through the development of innovative products and services, which have helped to ____________________ our competitors.
questions.explanation: The sentence is describing the company's competitive advantage, which suggests that the correct answer should be related to surpassing or outdoing competitors. Option A, 'surpass', is the most suitable choice as it implies a superior performance.

questions.question_text: All new patients are required to fill out a medical history form _____ they have their first appointment.
questions.explanation: 句子使用一般過去式，表明所有新的病人都需要在他們第一次就診時填寫醫療史資料。

questions.question_text: Patients with a high risk of developing complications _____ regular check-ups are recommended.
questions.explanation: The sentence requires a relative clause to describe the patients. Option D, 'are those who', is the correct choice as it provides the necessary information about the patients.

questions.question_text: The new product development team has been working on a _____ prototype for several months.
The new product development team has been working on a project to _____ the current manufacturing process.
questions.explanation: The sentence is asking about the purpose of the project, which can be inferred from the phrase 'to improve'. The correct answer 'streamline' means to make a process more efficient or streamlined.

questions.question_text: The company has been increasing its investments in ___________ countries to diversify its portfolio.
questions.explanation: 句子中使用了介詞which作為定語從属關係，指明被investments所涉及的國家。選項A Asian不符合句子的語意；選項C in which是錯誤的表達方式；選項D that指的是主詞company，而不是目的地 countries。

questions.question_text: The new apartment complex offers a range of amenities, including a gym and swimming pool _____ residents are required to pay an additional fee.
questions.explanation: 句子使用了子句修飾前置名詞，選項 D 是正確答案，因為它符合句子的語法結構，指出需要付費的條件。

questions.question_text: The new employee handbook emphasizes the importance of _____ timely feedback to improve job performance.
questions.explanation: 選項 D 的正確性在於，句子中的關鍵詞是「timely feedback」，這個feedback 是給員工的，因此應該選擇「being given」，而不是其他選項。

questions.question_text: The new employee will have finished the training program ______ his first day on the job.
questions.explanation: 本題考察了使用將來完成式（will have finished）以表達某個事件在未來完成的狀態，選項 D（after having）正確地表達了時間點與完成事件的關係。

questions.question_text: The new employee manual has been updated regularly _____ the company's values and policies.
questions.explanation: 這題目考查 since, while, until 和 as soon as 四個時間副詞的使用。since 表示從某個點開始到現在，while 表示同時進行的兩件事情，until 表示直到某個點止，as soon as 表示隨即或立刻。在這題目中，since 和 until 都可以用，但是 since 是更適合的選項，因為 manual 的更新是連續的，而不是在某個特定的時候。

questions.question_text: The new employee was given a comprehensive orientation package _____ the company’s policies and procedures.
questions.explanation: 句子中使用了定語從句，表示在新員工開始工作前進行的某些步驟。選項 C 是正確答案，因為在這個空格處需要表達一個在公司政策和程序開始之前的事件。

questions.question_text: The new laboratory equipment has been designed to meet the latest _____ standards.
questions.explanation: 此題考察了文本中的時間關係，選項 D（upcoming）正確，因為最新標準是指未來的規範。其它選項都是過去或現在的概念，與文本無關。

questions.question_text: The new office building is designed to be energy-efficient and will have a more sustainable impact on the environment by reducing its _____ in half.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'energy consumption' because the sentence describes the new office building's aim to reduce its energy usage.

questions.question_text: The company's new product development team focuses on creating innovative products that meet the needs of our customers, and this process typically takes _____.
questions.explanation: 此題考查了英文句子的語法結構，specifically the use of the adjective 'innovative' to describe the company's product development process。選項 A longest正確，因為它描述了產品開發的時間長度。

questions.question_text: _the new store has been operating successfully since it was opened last year, but _______________ the initial investment was quite high.
questions.explanation: 本題考查present perfect tense的使用。句子中使用since引導的since-clause表達時間關係，故應選擇在since後面的option D "in spite of"。

questions.question_text: The company's new policy requires all employees to submit their expense reports _____ by the end of each quarter.
questions.explanation: 本題考察了語句中的「by the end of each quarter」所表達的時間點，要求員工在每個季度結束前提交報表，因此正確答案是 before。

questions.question_text: Patients are required to have a medical examination _____ they receive any treatment at our clinic.
questions.explanation: The sentence uses the present perfect tense to describe a condition that must be met before something else can happen. The correct answer is 'before', as it indicates the timing of the medical examination in relation to receiving treatment.

questions.question_text: The medical center offers a wide range of services, including routine _____ for children and adults.
questions.explanation: 選項 D "treatments" 是正確答案，因為句子中描述醫療中心提供的服務，包括兒童和成人之間的例行處理。

questions.question_text: By the time you _____ your doctor for a check-up, you should have filled out the necessary forms.
questions.explanation: 本題目考查過去完成式的使用。由於check-up 是一種預防性醫療action，所以下文描述中應該使用一般過去完成式（simple past），而不是完了完成式（completed past）或將來完成式（future perfect）。

questions.question_text: The company has established a policy to ensure that all employees are _____ to access the new software.
questions.explanation: 選項 A「trained」是正確答案，因為它符合句子的语義，指出員工被授權或準備好使用新的軟體。

questions.question_text: At the dental clinic, patients are advised to _____ their teeth after meals.
questions.explanation: This sentence uses the present passive voice, describing a general habit or routine. The correct answer is A, 'brush regularly', because it fits the context of dental care advice.

questions.question_text: According to the company's instructions, all test results should be submitted _____ a designated email address.
questions.explanation: 這題考察 preposition 的用法，空格前有明確的指向 'a designated email address'，因此選項 D 'in' 是正確的選項。

questions.question_text: The new employee was asked to _____ the company's policies and procedures within a week of joining.
questions.explanation: 選項 B "read" 是正確的，因為在句子中使用了「within a week of joining」，表示一個新的行為或動作，需要進行某種讀取或了解公司政策和程序。選項 A "to read" 是不正確的，因為它們不能被用於描述一個新的行為或動作。

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy was designed to appeal to a wider audience, as it is essential that our products _____ to the changing tastes and preferences.
questions.explanation: 本題目考查了主句中的目的狀態（to cater），選項 D 是唯一正確的選項，其他選項都無法將主句連接到目的狀態上。

questions.question_text: The company's new marketing strategy aims to increase sales _____ recent quarter.
questions.explanation: 在這個句子中，empty space 是指「to increase sales」所需的時間範圍。選項 D "from" 表示自某個時間點開始，所以是正確答案。

questions.question_text: The patient was advised to _____ follow-up examination at the clinic within two weeks.
questions.explanation: 選項 D "have a"是正確的，因為句子使用過去式（was advised），因此需要使用一般將來時（will have）進行預設action，表示病人需要在兩周內進行檢查。

questions.question_text: The new product development process at XYZ Inc. is designed to _____ the time it takes to bring a product from concept to market.
questions.explanation: 選項 A 的「reduce」是正确的语句，因为句子中使用了被动 voice，需要一个单词来表示过程的结果。

questions.question_text: The company has been conducting market research on the new product, which is expected to be launched _____ next quarter.
questions.explanation: The sentence uses the future continuous tense to describe an expected event, indicating that it will take place at a specific point in time. The correct answer is 'as soon as', which fits with the timing of the market research and product launch.

questions.question_text: Patients are advised to _____ their appointment schedule if they need to reschedule or cancel.
questions.explanation: 本題目考查語法單句的主動詞形式，選項 C「change」正確因為主詞是 Patients，而主動詞是 change。

questions.question_text: The company's policy is to _____________ employee feedback in decision-making processes.
questions.explanation: 此題考查句子的語法，特別是用法的正確性。選項 D 是唯一正確的答案，因為它正好fit 句子的結構，滿足了句子的需求。

questions.question_text: The company's new policy requires all employees to _____ a minimum of 40 hours of training per quarter.
questions.explanation: 這題考察主動語態的使用，「require」是一個需要完成某種行為的動詞，因此在句子中應該使用「have」（主動語態）而不是其他選項。

questions.question_text: The new employee has been attending leadership training sessions _____ he started working at the company.
questions.explanation: 在這個句子中，使用了完成式（Perfect Continuous）tense，以表示某個事件的開始時間不明確，但是在某個點開始進行某些活動。因此，在這裡選項 C 是正確的，因為它描述了某個點開始進行某些活動，從而使完成式 tense 適用。

questions.question_text: The company's recent survey revealed that most employees are satisfied with their jobs _____ they were hired.
questions.explanation: 選項 D "as soon as" 是正確答案，因為它們是對於兩個事件的關係，表示某件事發生在另一件事之前。其他選項都無法表達這種關係。

questions.question_text: By the end of the financial year, the bank has _____ all its outstanding loans.
questions.explanation: 這題考察的是過去完成式（Past Perfect），在金融年-end時點，銀行已經清償了所有債務。

questions.question_text: According to company policy, all new hires are required to attend an orientation session _____ their first week of work.
questions.explanation: 句子使用了「according to」phrase，表明公司政策的規定。空格部分使用了「their first week of work」phrase作為 modifier，表示orientation session的時間，因此選項 C "after" 是正確的，因為這個session是在新員工的第一周工作後進行的。

questions: {"question_type":"reading","question_category":"syntax","passage_id":null,"material_id":null,"question_text":"According to company policy, all new hires are required to attend an orientation session _____ their first week of work.","part":5,"option_a_text":"during","option_b_text":"before","option_c_text":"after","option_d_text":"until","is_correct":"C","difficulty_level":3,"explanation":"句子使用了「according to」phrase，表明公司政策的規定。空格部分使用了「their first week of work」phrase作為 modifier，表示orientation session的時間，因此選項 C \"after\" 是正確的，因為這個session是在新員工的第一周工作後進行的。","created_at":"2025-09-04T19:00:24.199925","updated_at":"2025-09-04T19:00:24.200023","question_id":"e143d808-65f4-4d9e-9fac-be8e1e98b086"}

questions.question_text: The new patient information system at Green Valley Hospital ensures that all _____ are documented and easily accessible.
questions.explanation: The blank is filled by the word 'records' because it refers to patient information, which is a crucial aspect of hospital documentation.

questions: {"question_type":"reading","question_category":"vocab","passage_id":null,"material_id":null,"question_text":"The new patient information system at Green Valley Hospital ensures that all _____ are documented and easily accessible.","part":5,"option_a_text":"appointments","option_b_text":"records","option_c_text":"doctors","option_d_text":"patients","is_correct":"B","difficulty_level":3,"explanation":"The blank is filled by the word 'records' because it refers to patient information, which is a crucial aspect of hospital documentation.","created_at":"2025-09-05T06:54:30.552413","updated_at":"2025-09-05T06:54:30.552475","question_id":"e43460ac-4591-48ce-9c12-117d2374225d"}

questions.question_text: The financial reports from the last quarter show that the company’s revenue has increased by _____ percent over the same period last year.
questions.explanation: 選項 B significantly 是正確的，因為句子中需要一個副詞來修飾percent， significant 和 significationally 都不能用在這裡，而 significant 在這裡是形容詞，表達程度的強度。

questions: {"question_type":"reading","question_category":"syntax","passage_id":null,"material_id":null,"question_text":"The financial reports from the last quarter show that the company’s revenue has increased by _____ percent over the same period last year.","part":5,"option_a_text":"a significant","option_b_text":"significantly","option_c_text":"significant","option_d_text":"significatively","is_correct":"B","difficulty_level":3,"explanation":"選項 B significantly 是正確的，因為句子中需要一個副詞來修飾percent， significant 和 significationally 都不能用在這裡，而 significant 在這裡是形容詞，表達程度的強度。","created_at":"2025-09-05T06:57:19.019679","updated_at":"2025-09-05T06:57:19.019696","question_id":"1700cc0d-0c57-4d04-a10e-f5b16ef6314a"}

questions.question_text: The new marketing strategy was designed to target specific customer segments, which would help the company ______________ its market share.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is A because the sentence requires a verb phrase to describe the intended result of the marketing strategy, which is to increase the company's market share.

questions: {"question_type":"reading","question_category":"syntax","passage_id":null,"material_id":null,"question_text":"The new marketing strategy was designed to target specific customer segments, which would help the company ______________ its market share.","part":5,"option_a_text":"increase","option_b_text":"expanding","option_c_text":"to expand","option_d_text":"expandable","is_correct":"A","difficulty_level":3,"explanation":"The correct answer is A because the sentence requires a verb phrase to describe the intended result of the marketing strategy, which is to increase the company's market share.","created_at":"2025-09-05T07:00:23.390745","updated_at":"2025-09-05T07:00:23.390761","question_id":"965efd32-6574-4428-b7bc-60da782e27b7"}

questions.question_text: _the company has been operating for over 20 years and its financial statements are always carefully prepared__ by an independent auditing firm.
questions.explanation: 句子中使用了passive voice，主詞是company，auxiliary verb is has/been，所以答案為D have always been。

questions: {"question_type":"reading","question_category":"syntax","passage_id":null,"material_id":null,"question_text":"_the company has been operating for over 20 years and its financial statements are always carefully prepared__ by an independent auditing firm.","part":5,"option_a_text":"are always","option_b_text":"has always been","option_c_text":"is always being","option_d_text":"have always been","is_correct":"D","difficulty_level":3,"explanation":"句子中使用了passive voice，主詞是company，auxiliary verb is has/been，所以答案為D have always been。","created_at":"2025-09-12T16:00:39.326413","updated_at":"2025-09-12T16:00:39.326438","question_id":"852cc68e-0722-4c31-8c74-f0f39b37f896"}

questions.question_text: The company’s decision to invest in new technology is expected to increase productivity _____ the next quarter.
questions.explanation: 選項 D 的.by the time 表示時間點，符合句子的語意，因此是正確的選項。

questions: {"question_type":"reading","question_category":"syntax","passage_id":null,"material_id":null,"question_text":"The company’s decision to invest in new technology is expected to increase productivity _____ the next quarter.","part":5,"option_a_text":"despite","option_b_text":"once","option_c_text":"until","option_d_text":"by the time","is_correct":"D","difficulty_level":3,"explanation":"選項 D 的.by the time 表示時間點，符合句子的語意，因此是正確的選項。","created_at":"2025-09-12T17:00:33.400516","updated_at":"2025-09-12T17:00:33.400545","question_id":"a34aada1-18d1-4100-b7b7-81b818e1e3df"}

questions.question_text: The company has decided to _____ its marketing strategy next quarter, focusing more on social media and online platforms.
questions.explanation: The blank space indicates the correct form of the verb 'renew' in this sentence, which is a infinitive phrase. Option B "to renew" matches the syntax and tense requirements.

questions.question_text: The company's new policy requires that all employees _____ their work hours to meet the increasing demand.
questions.explanation: 此題考察的是主句中的受詞phrase，require某物做某事。因此選項 B 的to adjust正確，因为它是表示 Employees 需要根據工作需求進行調整的。

questions: {"question_type":"reading","question_category":"syntax","passage_id":null,"material_id":null,"question_text":"The company's new policy requires that all employees _____ their work hours to meet the increasing demand.","part":5,"option_a_text":"adjusting","option_b_text":"adjust to","option_c_text":"to adjust","option_d_text":"adjust for","is_correct":"B","difficulty_level":3,"explanation":"此題考察的是主句中的受詞phrase，require某物做某事。因此選項 B 的to adjust正確，因为它是表示 Employees 需要根據工作需求進行調整的。","created_at":"2025-09-16T16:00:49.377364","updated_at":"2025-09-16T16:00:49.377388","question_id":"a8e7c60f-c342-4deb-90f0-4293a85e5ce8"}

questions.question_text: The company will consider your application _____ it has been thoroughly reviewed.
questions.explanation: The sentence is in the future tense, using the phrase 'will consider'. The correct verb form is 'after', which indicates the action will be taken after the thorough review.

The correct verb form is 'after', which indicates the action will be taken after the thorough review.","created_at":"2025-09-16T17:00:41.616474","updated_at":"2025-09-16T17:00:41.616527","question_id":"43b62f20-fa58-4eb7-a478-4a8e6ea87e9a"}

questions.question_text: The new policy encourages employees to take advantage of _____ training opportunities available online.
questions.explanation: The blank is a noun phrase that refers to training opportunities. The correct answer, 'available', fits grammatically and semantically.
